Boardwalk Collaboration Platform REST APIs



      • 1. General Information


        Boardwalk's REST API defines a set of functions which developers can perform requests and receive responses via HTTP protocol such as GET and POST.

        Earlier Boardwalk's Grid-based database was only accessible using Microsoft Excel and Boardwalk's Neighborhoood and User Management was possible through Web-based Portal. In that case Microsoft Excel and Browser was an essential Client softwares to invoke and use Boardwalk Services.

        REST APIs can be called using REST Client running over any Operating System on any device.



      • 1.1 Overview






      • 1.2 Purpose


        The purpose of this document is to describe

        List of available REST APIs
        How REST APIs are called using CURL
        JSON Response returned by REST APIs
        Error conditions and response to these error conditions by REST APIs






        • 1.3 List of available REST APIs


          The list of covered REST APIs in this document are :
          1 User Management Operations.
          2 Neighborhood Operations (User Groups, Memberships).
          3 Collaboration.




        • 1.3.1 User Management Operations






        • 1.3.2 Neighborhood Operations (User Groups, Memberships)






        • 1.3.3 Collaboration








          • 2. Getting Started


            Boardwalk's REST API has following modules:

            1. User Management
            2. Neighborhood Management
            3. Membership Management
            4. Collaboration Management
            5. Grid Management




          • 2.1 Pre - Requisites


            Server:
            Boardwalk Collaboration Platform Setup

            Client:
            Browser Utilities : POSTMAN or REST CLIENT.
            Command line Utilities : CURL

            This document describes the how Boardwalk's REST APIs are called using CURL utility and the JSON Response returned by REST API.





          • 2.2 Authentication


            At present Basic Authentication is provided for performing authentication over HTTP. It involves sending a Base-64 encoded username:password:nhPath within the Request Header to the Server. Every REST API Request has “Authorization” added into HTTP HEADER.

            For example: ‘admin’ who is member of neighborhood-path ‘ROOT’ having password ‘0’ is Base-64 encoded string of admin:0:ROOT which is YWRtaW46MDpST09U.
            So HTTP HEADER section of API Request has following line:

            Authorization: YWRtaW46MDpST09U

            The Server checks to see if the username exists within its system and verifies the sent password.










          • 3. User Management APIs


            To access the Boardwalk services; you must be a registered User in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
            To register as user, you need to call User Management Apis and provide Login Credintials. User Management APIs provide GET, POST, PUT, DELETE methods to manage User data.

            Following are the methods supported by User Management REST APIs:

            POST /User : To create a new User you need to call
            GET /user : To list a single User information or multiple users using Query Parameters
            DELETE /User : To de-activate a User





            • 3.1 GET /user Api : GET /user


              Following is the structure of User Object defined in User Management REST APIs.



            • 3.1.0 Status Code returned by GET /user


              Following are the Status Code returned by GET /user REST API call:

              200 Success. User details
              400 Bad Request. IsNegativeOrZero UserId
              401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header
              401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path
              404 Not found. User not found




            • 3.1.1 Valid GET /user request to read User with UserId


              Following is the GET /user Request that returns User details of UserId = 1


              curl command:
              Result:




              • 3.1.2 GET /user Error Conditions Handled


                Following are the Error Conditions returned by GET /user REST APIs

                1. Negative Or Zero UserId
                2. User NOT found
                3. Missing Authorization




              • 3.1.2.1 Negative Or Zero UserId


                Following Error is returned when Negative UserId is passed to GET /user REST API
                In this example UserId = -1 is passed to GET /user REST API.
                The API call returns the Error Message with Proposed Solution as a JSON Array.
                The Status Code returned is 400 i.e. Bad Request.

                curl command:
                Result:


              • 3.1.2.2 User not found


                Following Error is returned when Invalid UserId is passed to GET /user REST API
                In this example UserId = 1101010 is passed to GET /user REST API; is not present in Database.
                The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code 401.

                curl command:
                Result:


              • 3.1.2.3 Missing Authorization


                Following Error is returned when GET /user/1101010 REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                curl command:
                Result:




                • 3.2 GET /user using @QueryParam : GET /user?active=true


                  You can call GET /user method with @QueryParam to return the JSON list of all Active Users or all De-activated Users.



                • 3.2.0 Status Code returned by GET /user using @QueryParam


                  Following are the Status Code returned by GET /user with @QueryParam REST API call:

                  200 Success. Existing Users with Active flag
                  400 Bad Request. Null or missing first name, last name, external id, password, email
                  401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header
                  401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path
                  500 Server Error. something has gone wrong on the website's server, but the server could not be more specific on what the exact problem is.




                • 3.2.1 Valid GET /user Request to read all active Users using Query active=true


                  Following is the GET /user CURL command that returns the list of all de-activated users in JSON format.
                  The details of all Users with Active = True is returned as JSON array.
                  active=true is passed as QueryParam to GET /user REST API.

                  curl command:
                  Result:


                • 3.2.2 Valid GET /user Request to read all active Users using Query active=false


                  Following is the GET /user CURL command that returns the list of all de-activated users in JSON format.
                  The details of all Users with Active = False is returned as JSON array.
                  active=false is passed as QueryParam to GET /user REST API.

                  curl command:
                  Result:


                • 3.2.3 GET /user using @QueryParam Error Conditions Handled


                  Following are the Error Conditions returned by GET /user with QueryParams REST API

                  1. Missing Authorization




                • 3.2.3.1 Missing Authorization


                  Following Error is returned when GET /user?active=false REST API with QueryParam is called with no Authorization in header.
                  The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                  curl command:
                  Result:







                • 3.3 Create User : POST /user


                  POST /user method is used to Create new User in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform




                • 3.3.0 Status Code returned by POST /user


                  Following are the Status Code returned by POST /user REST API call:

                  200 Success. New user list.
                  400 Bad Request. Null or missing first name, last name, external id, password, email.
                  401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                  401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                  409 Conflict. The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target resource. This code is used in situations where the user might be able to resolve the conflict and resubmit the request.




                • 3.3.1 Valid POST User Request that succeeds to creation of new User


                  In following example POST /User REST API is called With Authorization to create a New User with following details:

                  email : "dummy@dummy.com", firstName : "dummy1", lastName : "dummy1", password : "dummy1", externalUserId : "dummyd", "userId": 0.

                  A new user is created successfully using above details with UserId: 1047.
                  The REST API returns JSON Array with newly created User's information in it. This also includes "id" : 1047 in returned JSON Array.
                  The Status Code returned by REST API is 200.

                  curl command:
                  Result:


                • 3.3.2 POST User Error Conditions handled


                  Following are the Error Conditions returned by POST /User REST APIs

                  1. Invalid PUT Request with Blank Name and Password WITH AUTHORIZATION.
                  2. Invalid Neighborhood Path: INVALID AUTHORIZATION case of Invalid Neighborhood Path.
                  3. (Duplicate User) Fail to create User when Email exists in the Database.
                  4. Invalid Login Details: User and Password are Invalid.





                • 3.3.2.1 Invalid PUT Request with Blank Name and Password WITH AUTHORIXATION


                  Following are the required data to create a new User:

                  firstName
                  lastName
                  password
                  userEmail
                  externalUserId

                  In example below POST /User REST API returns Error Messages as JSON Array when firstName, lastName, password, email and externalUserId is passed as Blank.
                  The Status Code returned by REST API is 400.


                  curl command:
                  Result:


                • 3.3.2.2 Invalid Neighborhood Path: INVALID AUTHORIZATION


                  The User must be the member of Neighborhood Path specified in Authorization Header (Decoded Base64 string).
                  If User is not member of that Neighborhood Path, the Authorization fails.
                  The Status Code returned by REST API is 401.


                  curl command:
                  Result:


                • 3.3.2.3 Duplicate User


                  The userEmail in User Information must be Unique in the database. The POST /user REST API check the user details for the unequeness of userEmail.
                  If API call tries to create a Duplicate User; the API return Error Message with Proposed Solution as JSON Array.
                  The Status Code returned by REST API is 409.


                  curl command:
                  Result:


                • 3.3.2.4 Invalid Login Details: User and Password are Invalid


                  The POST /user REST API authenticates the UserName and Password using the Authorization details in HTTP Header.
                  The Authorization Header contains UserName and Password in encrypted format. These are the Login Credintials of the User calling the POST /user REST API .
                  The REST API validates these Login Credintials and if it fails; it returns the Error Message as a JSON Array.
                  The Status Code returned by REST API is 401.


                  curl command:
                  Result:







                • 3.4 Update User : PUT /user


                  PUT /user method is used to update an existing User's data in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform
                  User details to be updated are passed in JSON format in HTTP body.



                • 3.4.0 Status Code returned by PUT /user


                  Following are the Status Code returned by PUT /user REST API call:

                  200 Success. String : User successfully updated.
                  400 Bad Request. Null or missing first name, last name, external id, password, email.
                  401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                  401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                  409 Conflict. The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target resource. This code is used in situations where the user might be able to resolve the conflict and resubmit the request.




                • 3.4.1 Valid PUT /user Request that succeeds to updation of an existing User


                  In following example PUT /user REST API is called With Authorization to update an Existing User with following details:

                  userEmail : "sg@sg.com", firstName : "sssss", lastName : "gggggggg", password : "sgsg", externalUserId : "sg", "userId": 1044.

                  A user with userId=1044 is successfully updated with above details. The REST API returns a String message as "Successfully updated profile of = 1044."
                  The Status Code returned by REST API is 200.

                  curl command:
                  Result:




                  • 3.4.2 PUT /user Error Conditions handled


                    Following are the Error Conditions returned by PUT /user REST API:

                    1. User Profile Does not exist .
                    2. Blank Name and Password, Email, ExternalId in Request .
                    3. Missing Name and Password, Email, ExternalId .




                  • 3.4.2.1 User Profile Does not exist


                    In following example PUT /user REST API is called With Authorization to update an User that does not exists in database (UserId=1044345).
                    The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 409.

                    curl command:
                    Result:


                  • 3.4.2.2 Blank Name and Password, Email, ExternalId in Request


                    In following example PUT /user REST API is called With Authorization to update an User with Blank information for an Existing User (UserId=1044).
                    The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 400.

                    curl command:
                    Result:


                  • 3.4.2.3 Missing Name and Password, Email, ExternalId


                    In following example PUT /user REST API is called With Authorization to update an User with Missing information for an Existing User (UserId=1044).
                    The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 400.

                    curl command:
                    Result:




                    • 3.5 De-activate User : DELETE /user/{userId}


                      DELETE /user method is used for deleting an existing User's data in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform
                      The userId of the User to be deleted is passed in API path.



                    • 3.5.0 Status Code returned by DELETE /user/{userId}


                      Following are the Status Code returned by DELETE /user/{userId} REST API call:

                      200 Success. String : User successfully deleted.
                      400 Bad Request. IsNegativeOrZero UserId.
                      401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                      401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                      404 Not found. User not found.




                    • 3.5.1 Valid DELETE User Request that succeeds in de-activating an existing User


                      In following example DELETE /user REST API is called With Authorization to de-activate an Existing User in Boardwalk Database:
                      A user with userId=1044 is successfully de-activated. The REST API returns a String message as "User de-activated successfully. UserId:1044"
                      The Status Code returned by REST API is 200.

                      curl command:
                      Result:




                      • 3.5.2 DELETE User Error Conditions handled


                        Following are the Error Conditions returned by DELETE /user REST API:

                        1. DELETE User Request with MISSING AUTHORIZATION.
                        2. User NOT FOUND.
                        3. Negative UserId Entered.




                      • 3.5.2.1 Missing Authorization


                        Following Error is returned when DELETE /user/1044 REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                        The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                        curl command:
                        Result:


                      • 3.5.2.2 User NOT FOUND


                        In following example DELETE/user REST API is called With Authorization to de-activate an User that does not exists in database (UserId=1044345).
                        The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                        curl command:
                        Result:


                      • 3.5.2.3 Negative UserId Entered


                        Following Error is returned when Negative UserId is passed to DELETE /user REST API:
                        In this example UserId = -451044 is passed to DELETE /user REST API. The API call returns the Error Message with Proposed Solution as a JSON Array.
                        The Status Code returned is 400 i.e. Bad Request.

                        curl command:
                        Result:




                        • 4. Neighborhood Management APIs


                          Boardwalk has Neighborhood Management REST APIs for following purpose:

                          1. To create Neighborhood upto level 4.
                          2. To create user membership to the Neighborhood.
                          3. Create Relations for Neighborhood.
                          4. Create Collaborations in Neighborhood.

                          Neighborhood Management APIs provide GET, POST, PUT, DELETE methods to manage Neighborhood related operations.

                          Following are the methods supported by Neighborhood Management REST APIs:

                          POST /Neighborhood : To create a new Neighborhood.
                          GET /Neighborhood: To get Neighbhood information using Neighborhood Id.
                          DELETE /Neighborhood : To delete a Neighborhood.
                          POST /neighborhood/{nhId}/member: To create a membership to a Neighborhood.
                          DELETE /neighborhood/{nhId}/member: To delete a membership of a Neighborhood.
                          GET /Neighborhood/{nhId}/relation: To get Relations defined on Neighborhood.
                          POST /Neighborhood/{nhId}/relation: To create a new Relation on Neighborhood.
                          DELETE /Neighborhood/{nhId}/relation: To delete a Relation on Neighborhood.
                          GET /Neighborhood/{nhId}/relation/{relation}/Neighborhood: To get Neighborhood of given path (need verify).






                          • 4.1 Create Neighborhood : POST /neighborhood


                            POST /neighborhood method is used to Create new Neighborhood in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                            Following is the structure of Neighborhood Object defined in Neighborhood Management REST APIs:




                          • 4.1.0 Status Code returned by POST /neighborhood


                            Following are the Status Code returned by POST /neighborhood REST API call:

                            200 Success. Returns list of Neighborhood.
                            400 Bad Request. missing nhName, Negative parentNhId.
                            401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                            401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                            404 Not found. Parent NeighborhoodId not found.
                            409 Conflict. NhName must be Unique under a parent.




                          • 4.1.1 Creating new Neighborhood at 0 level (Root level)


                            Following POST /neighborhood REST API call creates a Neaghborhood at Level 0.
                            It returns the details of newly created Neighborhood as a JSON Array. In this example a new Neighborhood with name "NH_0_With_Auth" is created at Level 0 with nhId = 35.
                            Note that to create Neighborhood at Level 0; the parentNhId is passed as -1.
                            It returns Status Code 200.

                            curl command:
                            Result:


                          • 4.1.2 Creating new Neighborhood at level 1 (Below level 0)


                            Following POST /neighborhood REST API call creates a Neaghborhood at Level 1.
                            It returns the details of newly created Neighborhood as a JSON Array. In this example a new Neighborhood with name "NH_1_With_Auth" is created at Level 1 with nhId = 37.
                            Note that to create Neighborhood at Level 1; the parentNhId is passed as 35 under that the new neighborhood "NH_1_With_Auth" is created.
                            It returns Status Code 200.

                            curl command:
                            Result:


                          • 4.1.3 Creating new Neighborhood at level 2 (Below level 1)


                            Following POST /neighborhood REST API call creates a Neaghborhood at Level 2.
                            It returns the details of newly created Neighborhood as a JSON Array. In this example a new Neighborhood with name "Boardwalk API" is created at Level 2 with nhId = 39.
                            Note that to create Neighborhood at Level 2; the parentNhId is passed as 38 under that the new neighborhood "Boardwalk API" is created.
                            It returns Status Code 200.

                            curl command:
                            Result:


                          • 4.1.4 Creating new Neighborhood at level 3 (Below level 2)


                            Following POST /neighborhood REST API call creates a Neaghborhood at Level 3.
                            It returns the details of newly created Neighborhood as a JSON Array. In this example a new Neighborhood with name "BAE_4_#" is created at Level 3 with nhId = 40.
                            Note that to create Neighborhood at Level 3; the parentNhId is passed as 39 under that the new neighborhood "BAE_4_#" is created.
                            It returns Status Code 200.

                            curl command:
                            Result:




                            • 4.1.5 POST Neighborhood Error Conditions handled


                              Following are the Error Conditions returned by POST /neighborhood REST API:

                              1 Duplicate Neighborhood creation at level 0 WITH AUTHORIZATION.
                              2 Duplicate Neighborhood creation at level 1, 2 and 3 WITH AUTHORIZATION.
                              3 Parent Neighborhood NOT FOUND.
                              4 Invalid Inputs: Negative Parent Neighborhood ID, Neighborhood nhName Blank.




                            • 4.1.5.1 Duplicate Neighborhood creation at level 0 WITH AUTHORIZATION


                              Following POST /neighborhood REST API call tries to create a Duplicate Neighborhood "NH_0_WITH_AUTH" at Level 0.
                              The REST API returns an Error Message in JSON Format.
                              It returns Status Code 409.

                              curl command:
                              Result:


                            • 4.1.5.2 Duplicate Neighborhood creation at level 1, 2 and 3 WITH AUTHORIZATION


                              Following POST /neighborhood REST API call tries to create a Duplicate Neighborhood "Boardwalk API" at Level 2.
                              The REST API returns an Error Message in JSON Format.
                              It returns Status Code 409.

                              curl command:
                              Result:


                            • 4.1.5.3 Parent Neighborhood NOT FOUND


                              Following POST /neighborhood REST API call tries to create a Neighborhood "NH_0_WITH_AUTH" below Neighborhood Id = 99999, that Does Not Exists..
                              The REST API returns an Error Message in JSON Format.
                              It returns Status Code 404.

                              curl command:
                              Result:


                            • 4.1.5.4 Invalid Inputs: Negative Parent Neighborhood ID, Neighborhood nhName Blank


                              Following POST /neighborhood REST API call tries to create a Neighborhood by passing Invalid Details.
                              In this example; Neighborhood Name is passed as BLANK (nhName: " "), the parent NeighborhoodId is passed as Negative Number (parentNhId:-5)..
                              The REST API returns an Error Message in JSON Format.
                              It returns Status Code 400.

                              curl command:
                              Result:




                              • 4.2 Get Neighborhood : GET /neighborhood/{nhId}


                                GET /neighborhood method is used to read Neighborhood details in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.




                              • 4.2.0 Status Code returned by GET /neighborhood/{nhId}


                                Following are the Status Code returned by GET /neighborhood/{nhId} REST API call:

                                200 Success. Neighborhood collection returned.
                                400 Bad Request. Negative nhId.
                                401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                404 Not found. Neighborhood Not found.
                                500 Server Error. Server-side Error fetching Neighborhood.




                              • 4.2.1 Get Neighborhood Hierarchy successfully with Authorization Header


                                Following GET /neighborhood REST API method is used to read all Neighborhood details (Neighborhood Hierarchy) below the Neighborhood Id = 1.
                                The details of all Neighborhoods present below Neighborhood ID = 1 are returned as JSON Array.
                                Each Neighborhood Details contains nhId, level, nhName, parentNhId, isSecure.
                                The REST API returns Status Code 200.

                                curl command:
                                Result:




                                • 4.2.2 GET Nieghborhood Error Conditions handled


                                  Following are the Error Conditions returned by GET /neighborhood REST API:

                                  1 Missing Aughorization Header in Get Neighborhood Request.
                                  2 Neighborhood NOT found.




                                • 4.2.2.1 Missing Aughorization Header in Get Neighborhood Request


                                  Following Error is returned when GET /neighborhood REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                                  The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                                  curl command:
                                  Result:


                                • 4.2.2.2 Neighborhood NOT found


                                  In following example GET /neighborhood/1998656 REST API is called With Authorization to get Neighborhood Hierarchy under Neighborhood "1998656" that Does Not Exists in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                                  The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                  curl command:
                                  Result:




                                  • 4.3 Delete Neighborhood : DELETE /neighborhood/{nhId}


                                    DELETE /neighborhood method is used to delete Neighborhood and it's related objects in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.




                                  • 4.3.0 Status Code returned by DELETE /neighborhood/{nhId}


                                    Following are the Status Code returned by DELETE /neighborhood/{nhId} REST API call:

                                    200 Success. Neighborhood Deleted Successfully. All it's dependent objects are purged successfully.
                                    400 Bad Request. Negative nhId.
                                    401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                    401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                    404 Not found. Neighborhood Not found.
                                    500 Server Error. Failed to Delete Neighborhood. BoardwalkException: Contact Boardwalk Support.




                                  • 4.3.1 Successful Delete of an existing valid Neighborhood


                                    In following example DELETE /neighborhood REST API is called With Authorization to delete Neighborhood hierarchy of Neighborhood Id '39':
                                    The neighborhood with nhId=39 and all objects defined below this neighborhood are successfully deleted from Boardwalk Database.
                                    The REST API returns a String message as "Neighborhood Deleted Successfully. All its dependent objects are purged successfully."
                                    The Status Code returned by REST API is 200.

                                    curl command:
                                    Result:




                                    • 4.3.2 DELETE Nieghborhood Error Conditions handled


                                      Following are the Error Conditions returned by DELETE /neighborhood REST API:

                                      1 Missing Authorization.
                                      2 Neighborhood not found.
                                      3 Invaid Input: Negative Neighborhood Id.




                                    • 4.3.2.1 Missing Authorization


                                      Following Error is returned when DELETE /neighborhood/32 REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                                      The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                                      curl command:
                                      Result:


                                    • 4.3.2.2 Neighborhood not found


                                      In following example DELETE/neighborhood REST API is called With Authorization to delete Neighborhood that does not exists in database (nhId=32).
                                      The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                      curl command:
                                      Result:


                                    • 4.3.2.3 Invaid Input: Negative Neighborhood Id


                                      Following Error is returned when Negative Neigborhood Id (nhId = -343) is passed to DELETE /neighborhood REST API:
                                      In this example nhId = -343 is passed to DELETE /neighborhood REST API. The API call returns the Error Message with Proposed Solution as a JSON Array.
                                      The Status Code returned is 400 i.e. Bad Request.

                                      curl command:
                                      Result:




                                      • 4.4 Get Neighborhood Members : GET /neighborhood/{nhId}/member


                                        GET /neighborhood/{nhId}/member method is used to read Membership details of the Neighborhood in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                                        Following is the structure of Member Object defined in Neighborhood Management REST APIs:



                                      • 4.4.0 Status Code returned by GET /neighborhood/{nhId}/member


                                        Following are the Status Code returned by GET /neighborhood/{nhId}/member REST API call:

                                        200 Success. The member list returned.
                                        400 Bad Request. Negative nhId.
                                        401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                        401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                        404 Not found. Neighborhood Not found.
                                        500 Server Error. Get Neighborhood Members Failed.




                                      • 4.4.1 Get Members of the Neighborhood {nhId} with Authorization Successfully


                                        Following GET /neighborhood/6/member REST API method is used to read all Membership details of Neighborhood Id = 6.
                                        The Membership details of Neighborhood ID = 1 are returned as JSON Array.
                                        Each Member Details contains memberId, nhId, userId, isActive.
                                        The Status Code returned by REST API is 200..

                                        curl command:
                                        Result:




                                        • 4.4.2 GET Member Error Conditions handled


                                          Following are the Error Conditions returned by GET /neighborhood/{nhId}/member REST API:

                                          1 MISSING Authorization.
                                          2 No members present in Neighborhood.
                                          3 Neighborhood not Found.
                                          4 Invalid Neighborhood Id (Negative Number).




                                        • 4.4.2.1 MISSING Authorization


                                          Following Error is returned when GET /neighborhood/6/member REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                                          The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                                          curl command:
                                          Result:


                                        • 4.4.2.2 No members present in Neighborhood


                                          Following GET /neighborhood/27/member REST API method return Empty JSON Array as there are no members present in Neighborhood Id = 27.


                                          curl command:
                                          Result:


                                        • 4.4.2.3 Neighborhood not Found


                                          In following example GET /neighborhood/27990/member REST API is called With Authorization to get Membership Details under Neighborhood "27990" that Does Not Exists in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                                          The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                          curl command:
                                          Result:


                                        • 4.4.2.4 Invalid Neighborhood Id (Negative Number)


                                          Following POST /neighborhood/-27990/member REST API call tries to read Membership Details of Neighborhood by passing Invalid Details.
                                          In this example; NeighborhoodId is passed as Negative Number (nhId:-27990)..
                                          The REST API returns an Error Message in JSON Format.
                                          It returns Status Code 400.

                                          curl command:
                                          Result:




                                          • 4.5 Create Neighborhood Member : POST /neighborhood/{nhId}/member


                                            POST /neighborhood/{nhId}/member method is used to Create new Neighborhood Member in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                                            Following is the structure of Member Object defined in Neighborhood Management REST APIs:




                                          • 4.5.0 Status Code returned by POST /neighborhood/{nhId}/member


                                            Following are the Status Code returned by POST /neighborhood/{nhId}/member REST API call:

                                            200 Success. Membership created successfully.
                                            400 Bad Request. Negative nhId, Negative userId.
                                            401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                            401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                            404 Not found. Neighborhood Not found.
                                            404 Not found. User Not Found.
                                            500 Server Error. Creating new membership to Neighborhood Failed.




                                          • 4.5.1 Valid POST Request that succeeds to creation of new Membership of a User for a Neighborhood


                                            Following POST /neighborhood/11/member REST API call creates a new Membership for UserId=1033 in Neighborhood=11.
                                            It returns the details of newly created Membership as a JSON Array. In this example a new Membership is created with memberId = 1024.
                                            Note that Member Object is passed as parameter in HTTP Body as follows : { "userId": 1003}
                                            The new membership is created on server successfully and REST API returns Member Object with newly created Membership Details as JSON Arrray shown below:
                                            [{"active":true,"id":1024,"nhid":11,"userId":1003}]
                                            The Return Status Code is 200.

                                            curl command:
                                            Result:




                                            • 4.5.2 POST Member Error Conditions handled


                                              Following are the Error Conditions returned by POST /neighborhood/{nhId}/member REST API:

                                              1 Missing Authorization.
                                              2 User is already a member of Neighborhood.
                                              3 Invalid Neighborhood.
                                              4 Invalid User.




                                            • 4.5.2.1 Missing Authorization


                                              Following Error is returned when POST /neighborhood/11/member REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                                              The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                                              curl command:
                                              Result:


                                            • 4.5.2.2 User is already a member of Neighborhood


                                              The POST /neighborhood/11/member REST API is called fails when following Member Object is passed to Create a New Membership in the Neighborhood = 11.
                                              { "userId": 1003}
                                              In this example userId=1003 is already a member of this Neighborhood, So Creating new membership to Neighborhood Fails.
                                              The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 500.

                                              curl command:
                                              Result:


                                            • 4.5.2.3 Invalid Neighborhood


                                              The POST /neighborhood/19651/member REST API is called fails when following Member Object is passed to Create a New Membership in the Neighborhood = 19651.
                                              { "userId": 1003}
                                              In this example Neighborhood = 19651 Does Not Exist So Creating new membership to Neighborhood Fails.
                                              The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 404.

                                              curl command:
                                              Result:


                                            • 4.5.2.4 Invalid User


                                              The POST /neighborhood/11/member REST API is called fails when following Member Object is passed to Create a New Membership in the Neighborhood = 11.
                                              { "userId": 109903}
                                              In this example userId = 109903 Does Not Exist So Creating new membership to Neighborhood Fails.
                                              The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 404.

                                              curl command:
                                              Result:




                                              • 4.6 Delete Neighborhood Member : DELETE /neighborhood/{nhId}/member/{memberId}


                                                DELETE /neighborhood/{nhId}/member/{memberId} method is used to delete Neighborhood Membership in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.




                                              • 4.6.0 Status Code returned by DELETE /neighborhood/{nhId}/member/{memberId}


                                                Following are the Status Code returned by DELETE /neighborhood/{nhId}/member/{memberId} REST API call:

                                                200 Success. Membership deleted Successfully.
                                                400 Bad Request. Negative nhId, Negative memberId.
                                                401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                                401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                                404 Not found. Neighborhood Not found.
                                                404 Not found. The Membership Not Found.
                                                500 Server Error. Deleting membership of Neighborhood Failed.




                                              • 4.6.1 Valid DELETE Request that succeeds to deletion of an existing Membership of a Neighborhood with Authorization


                                                In following example DELETE /neighborhood/11/member/1024 REST API is called With Authorization to delete neighborhood Membership '1024' from Neighborhood 11:
                                                The membership with memberId=1024 is successfully deleted from Boardwalk Database.
                                                The REST API returns a String message as "Neighborhood Membership : 1024 of Neighborhood: 11 is Successfully Deleted."
                                                The Status Code returned by REST API is 200.

                                                curl command:
                                                Result:




                                                • 4.6.2 DELETE Member Error Conditions handled


                                                  Following are the Error Conditions returned by DELETE /neighborhood/{nhId}/member/{memberId} REST API:

                                                  1 Missing Authorization.
                                                  2 Invalid Inputs: Negative MemberId.
                                                  3 Invalid Inputs: Neighborhood NOT found.
                                                  4 Membershiop NOT found.




                                                • 4.6.2.1 Missing Authorization


                                                  Following Error is returned when DELETE /neighborhood/11/member/1024 REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                                                  The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                                                  curl command:
                                                  Result:


                                                • 4.6.2.2 Invalid Inputs: Negative MemberId


                                                  Following DELETE /neighborhood/11/member/-1024 REST API call returns Error as Negative Member Id (memberId = -1024) is passed to as parameter.
                                                  The API call returns the Error Message with Proposed Solution as a JSON Array.
                                                  The Status Code returned is 400 i.e. Bad Request.

                                                  curl command:
                                                  Result:


                                                • 4.6.2.3 Invalid Inputs: Neighborhood NOT found


                                                  In following example DELETE /neighborhood/1331/member/1019 REST API is called With Authorization to delete Membership from a Neighborhood (nhId=1331) that Does Not Exists in database.
                                                  The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                                  curl command:
                                                  Result:


                                                • 4.6.2.4 Membershiop NOT found


                                                  In following example DELETE /neighborhood/11/member/11019 REST API is called With Authorization to delete Membership (nhId=11019) that Does Not Exist from a Neighborhood (nhId=11).
                                                  The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                                  curl command:
                                                  Result:

                                                    GET /neighborhood/{nhId}/collaboration method is used to read Collaboration details of the Neighborhood in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                                                    Following is the structure of Collaboration Object defined in Neighborhood Management REST APIs:



                                                  • 4.10.01 GridInfo Object in Collaboration


                                                    Following is the structure of GridInfo Object defined in Neighborhood Management REST APIs:



                                                  • 4.10.02 Status Code returned by GET /neighborhood/{nhId}/collaboration

                                                    200 Success. Collaboration List is returned.
                                                    400 Bad Request. Negative nhId.
                                                    401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                                    401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                                    404 Not found. Neighborhood Not found.
                                                    500 Server Error. Server Error fetching Collaborations.




                                                  • 4.10.1 Successful Get Collaborations of the Neighborhood {nhId} when Collaboration exists


                                                    Following command returns entire Collaboration Hierarchy present under the Neighborhood 1.

                                                    curl command:
                                                    Result:


                                                  • 4.10.2 Successful Get Collaborations of the Neighborhood {nhId} when Collaboration does not exist (With Authorization)


                                                    Following command returns entire Collaboration Hierarchy present under the Neighborhood 26.
                                                    Neigborhood 26 does not contain any Collaboration so Empty JSON Array ([]) is returned.

                                                    curl command:
                                                    Result:




                                                    • 4.10.3 GET Collaboration Error Conditions handled


                                                      Following are the Error Conditions returned by GET /neighborhood/{nhId}/collaboration REST API:

                                                      1 MISSING Authorization.
                                                      2 Neighborhood Id Not Found.
                                                      3 Negative Neighborhood Id.




                                                    • 4.10.3.1 MISSING Authorization


                                                      Following Error is returned when GET /neighborhood/1/collaboration REST API is called with no Authorization in header.

                                                      Result:


                                                    • 4.10.3.2 Neighborhood Id Not Found

                                                      The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                                      curl command:
                                                      Result:


                                                    • 4.10.3.3 Negative Neighborhood Id

                                                      In this example; NeighborhoodId is passed as Negative Number (nhId:-1).

                                                      It returns Status Code 400.

                                                      • 4.11 Create Collaboratopm : POST /collaboration


                                                        POST /collaboration method is used to Create new Collaboration in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                                                        Note that New Collaboration is created under the Neighborhood Path present in Authorization Details. The User membership of that Neighborhood Path is used to create the new Collaboration.
                                                        Following is the structure of Collaboration Object defined in Neighborhood Management REST APIs:




                                                      • 4.11.0 Status Code returned by POST /collaboration


                                                        Following are the Status Code returned by POST /collaboration REST API call:

                                                        200 Success. List of newly generated Collaboration.
                                                        400 Bad Request. Null or Missing or Empty Collaboration Name.
                                                        401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                                        401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                                        409 Conflict. Collaboration already exists with this name.




                                                      • 4.11.1 Successful POST Collaborations


                                                        The following POST /collaboration REST API call creates a New Collaboration with name "REST-LAB" under the Neighborhood Path specified in Authorization Base64 Header.
                                                        It uses User Membership of the Neighborhood Path to create the new Collaboration. The REST API returns the newly generated Collaboration Object as JSON Array.
                                                        The REST API returns Status Code 200.

                                                        curl command:
                                                        Result:




                                                        • 4.11.2 POST Collaboration Error Conditions handled


                                                          Following are the Error Conditions returned by POST /collaboration REST API:

                                                          1 MISSING Authorization.
                                                          2 Invalid Authorization. User is not a member of Neighborhood Path. [NhID mismatch].
                                                          3 Missing Inputs: Collaboration name.
                                                          4 Invalid Inputs: Collaboration name is blank.
                                                          5 Collaboration already exists.




                                                        • 4.11.2.1 MISSING Authorization


                                                          Following Error is returned when POST /collaboration REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                                                          The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                                                          curl command:
                                                          Result:


                                                        • 4.11.2.2 Invalid Authorization. User is not a member of Neighborhood Path. [NhID mismatch]


                                                          Following Error is returned by POST /collaboration REST API when User tries to create a Collaboration in a Neighborhood of which he does not have membership.
                                                          The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                                                          curl command:
                                                          Result:


                                                        • 4.11.2.3 Missing Inputs: Collaboration name


                                                          Following Error is returned by POST /collaboration REST API when User tries to create a Collaboration with collabName is Missing in the Request.
                                                          The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 400.

                                                          curl command:
                                                          Result:


                                                        • 4.11.2.4 Invalid Inputs: Collaboration name is blank


                                                          Following Error is returned by POST /collaboration REST API when User tries to create a Collaboration with Blank collabName in the Request.
                                                          The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 400.

                                                          curl command:
                                                          Result:


                                                        • 4.11.2.5 Collaboration already exists


                                                          Following POST /collaboration returns an Error Messages as JSON Array when Collaboration is already existing in the Neighborhood Path.
                                                          It returns Status Code 409.

                                                          curl command:
                                                          Result:




                                                          • 4.12 Delete Collaboration : DELETE /collaboration/{collabId}

                                                            Following are the Status Code returned by DELETE /collaboration/{collabId} REST API call:

                                                            200 Success. Collaboration deleted successfully.
                                                            400 Bad Request. Negative collabId.
                                                            401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                                            401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                                            404 Not found. Collaboration ID NOT FOUND.
                                                            500 Server Error. Server Error fetching Collaborations.




                                                          • 4.12.1 Successful Delete of an existing valid Collaboration


                                                            In following example DELETE /collaboration/1022 REST API is called With Authorization to delete Collaboration '1022':
                                                            The Collaboration with collabId=1022 is successfully deleted from Boardwalk Database.
                                                            The REST API returns a String message as "Collaboration Deleted Successfully"
                                                            The Status Code returned by REST API is 200.

                                                            curl command:
                                                            Result:




                                                            • 4.12.2 DELETE Collaboration Error Conditions handled

                                                              2 Collaboration Not Found.

                                                              curl command:
                                                              Result:


                                                            • 4.12.2.2 Collaboration Not Found


                                                              In following example DELETE /collaboration/1019 REST API is called With Authorization to delete Collaboration (collabId=10221) that Does Not Exists in database.
                                                              The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                                              curl command:
                                                              Result:


                                                            • 4.12.2.3 Invalid Inputs: Negative Collaboration ID


                                                              Following DELETE /collaboration/-1020 REST API call returns Error as Negative Collaboration Id (collabId = -1020) is passed to as parameter.
                                                              The API call returns the Error Message with Proposed Solution as a JSON Array.
                                                              The Status Code returned is 400 i.e. Bad Request.

                                                              curl command:
                                                              Result:




                                                              • 4.13 Get Collaboration Whiteboards : GET /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard


                                                                GET /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST API method is used to read Whiteboard details in given Collaboration (collabId) Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                                                                The REST API returns Status Code 200.



                                                              • 4.13.0 Status Code returned by GET /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard


                                                                Following are the Status Code returned by GET /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST API call:

                                                                200 Success. Returns collabList for collabId including all Whiteboards in it.
                                                                400 Bad Request. Negative collabId.
                                                                401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                                                401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                                                404 Not found. Collaboration ID NOT FOUND.




                                                              • 4.13.1 Successful Get Whiteboards of the Collaboration {collabId} when collaboration exists


                                                                Following command returns entire list of Whiteboards present under the Collaboration 1. Following GET /collaboration/1/whiteboard REST API method is used to read all Whiteboard details of Collaboration Id = 1.
                                                                The Whiteboard details of Collaboration ID = 1 are returned as JSON Array.
                                                                Each Whiteboard Details contains wbId, wbName.
                                                                The Status Code returned by REST API is 200..

                                                                curl command:
                                                                Result:




                                                                • 4.13.2 GET Whiteboard Error Conditions handled


                                                                  Following are the Error Conditions returned by GET /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST API:

                                                                  1 Missing Authorization.
                                                                  2 Collaboration Not Found.
                                                                  3 Negative CollabID.




                                                                • 4.13.2.1 Missing Authorization


                                                                  Following Error is returned when GET /collaboration/1/whiteboard REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                                                                  The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                                                                  curl command:
                                                                  Result:


                                                                • 4.13.2.2 Collaboration Not Found


                                                                  In following example GET /collaboration/10039/whiteboard REST API is called With Authorization to get Whiteboard Details under Collaboration "10039" that Does Not Exists in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                                                                  The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                                                  curl command:
                                                                  Result:


                                                                • 4.13.2.3 Negative CollabID


                                                                  Following Error is returned when Negative Collaboration Id (collabId = -10039) is passed to GET /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST API:
                                                                  In this example (collabId = -10039) is passed to GET /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST API. The API call returns the Error Message with Proposed Solution as a JSON Array.
                                                                  The Status Code returned is 400 i.e. Bad Request.

                                                                  curl command:
                                                                  Result:




                                                                  • 4.14 Create Collaboration : POST /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard


                                                                    POST /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard method is used to Create new Whiteboard under a Collaboration in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.
                                                                    Following is the structure of Whiteboard Object defined in Neighborhood Management REST APIs:




                                                                  • 4.14.0 Status Code returned by POST /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard


                                                                    Following are the Status Code returned by POST /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST API call:

                                                                    200 Success. Whiteboard created successfully. Returns WhiteboardID.
                                                                    400 Bad Request. Negative collabId. Null or Missing or Empty Whiteboard Name.
                                                                    401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                                                    401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                                                    404 Not found. Collaboration ID NOT FOUND.
                                                                    409 Conflict. Creating new Whiteboard in Collaboration Failed. Whiteboard already exists.




                                                                  • 4.14.1 Successful creation of Whiteboard under the Collaborations {collabId}


                                                                    Following /collaboration/1003/whiteboard REST API call Creates a New Whiteboard with name "NEW TEST" under Collaboration Id 1003.
                                                                    The REST API returns newly generated Whiteboard Id as an Integer.
                                                                    The REST API returns Status Code 200.

                                                                    curl command:
                                                                    Result:




                                                                    • 4.14.2 POST Whiteboard Error Conditions handled


                                                                      Following are the Error Conditions returned by POST /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST APIs

                                                                      1 Duplicate Whiteboard.
                                                                      2 Missing Authorization.
                                                                      3 Invalid Inputs. Negative CollabId and Whiteboard Name as Blank OR Spaces.
                                                                      4 Collaboration Not Found.




                                                                    • 4.14.2.1 Duplicate Whiteboard


                                                                      The wbName i.e. Whiteboard Name in Whiteboard Information must be Unique in the Collaboration. The POST /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST API check the Whiteboard details for the unequeness of wbName.
                                                                      In this Example, the API call tries to create a Duplicate Whiteboard Test under the Collaboration 1003; the API return Error Message with Proposed Solution as JSON Array.
                                                                      The Status Code returned by REST API is 409.


                                                                      curl command:
                                                                      Result:


                                                                    • 4.14.2.2 Missing Authorization


                                                                      Following Error is returned when POST /collaboration/1003/whiteboard REST API is called with no Authorization in header.
                                                                      The REST API returns Error Message as a JSON Array with Status Code as 401.

                                                                      curl command:
                                                                      Result:


                                                                    • 4.14.2.3 Negative CollabId and Blank/Spaces as Whiteboard Name


                                                                      Following Error is returned when Negative Collaboration Id (collabId) and Blank Whiteboard Name (wbName) is passed to POST /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST API:
                                                                      In this example Negative collabId = -1003 is passed as POST /collaboration/-1003/whiteboard REST API.
                                                                      Inside Whiteboard Object, wbName is passed as BLANK.
                                                                      The API call returns the Error Message with Proposed Solution as a JSON Array.
                                                                      The Status Code returned is 400 i.e. Bad Request.


                                                                      curl command:
                                                                      Result:


                                                                    • 4.14.2.4 Collaboration Not Found


                                                                      In following example POST /collaboration/9903/whiteboard REST API is called with Authorization to Create a new Whiteboard under the Collaboration (collabId=9903) that Does Not Exists.
                                                                      The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                                                      curl command:
                                                                      Result:




                                                                      • 4.15 Delete Whiteboard : DELETE/collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard


                                                                        DELETE /collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard/{whiteboardId} REST API Call is used for Deleting an existing Whiteboard under a Collaboration in Boardwalk Collaboration Platform.




                                                                      • 4.15.0 Status Code returned by DELETE/collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard


                                                                        Following are the Status Code returned by DELETE/collaboration/{collabId}/whiteboard REST API call:

                                                                        200 Success. Whiteboard deleted successfully.
                                                                        400 Bad Request. Negative collabId, Negative whiteboardId.
                                                                        401 Unauthorized. Missing Authorization in Header.
                                                                        401 Unauthorized. Authentication failure, User is not member of Neighborhood path.
                                                                        404 Not found. Collaboration ID NOT FOUND.
                                                                        404 Not found. Whiteboard not found.




                                                                      • 4.15.1 Successful Delete of an existing Whiteboard


                                                                        In following example DELETE /collaboration/1005/whiteboard/1014 REST API is called With Authorization to delete Whiteboard (WhiteboardId=1014) under Collaboration (Collaboration Id = 1005):
                                                                        The Whiteboard with Whiteboard Id=1014 under Collaboration Collaboration Id = 1005 is successfully deleted from Boardwalk Database.
                                                                        The REST API returns a String message as "Whiteboard: [1014] under Collaboration:[1005] is successfully Deleted."
                                                                        The Status Code returned by REST API is 200.

                                                                        Result:

                                                                          4 Invalid Inputs: Negative Collaboration ID, Negative Whitebaord ID.

                                                                          curl command:
                                                                          Result:

                                                                          The REST API returns an Error Message as JSON Array. The Status Code returned by REST API is 404.

                                                                          curl command:
                                                                          Result:

                                                                          The API call returns the Error Message with Proposed Solution as a JSON Array.
                                                                          The Status Code returned is 400 i.e. Bad Request.
